summaries.broad: To leverage my diverse skill set in computer science and explore opportunities across various technology domains, such as mainframes and web development.

points.overview: Developed a web application enabling users to interact with mainframe held queues by listing, downloading, and purging job outputs via FTP.
points.users: Successfully serves the needs of 100+ users, maintaining consistent uptime with no reported issues.
points.crypto: Uses AES-256 encryption to store mainframe credentials in a non-plaintext format.
points.deployment: Easily deploys to several serverless environments with no configuration.
points.desktop: Developed a cross-platform desktop version using Rust, so that users have the choice of using a web or desktop app.

points.overview: Developed a tool to speed up the workflows of introductory programming students by automating keystrokes into a terminal.
points.docs: Wrote 3,500+ words of documentation, including installation instructions and examples.
points.spec: Discussed the specification with a professor to ensure that the program met his requirements.

lightspeed.title: Ecommerce Store
lightspeed.tech: PHP, Laravel, TypeScript, React.js, Stripe API, Linux

points.overview: Developed a full-stack web application which allows users to create customized versions of a product with interchangable options.
points.stripe: Integrated Stripe API for payment transactions.
points.deployment: Deployed the project to a Linux server via SSH.

points.overview: Wrote an algorithm in TypeScript to crop an image in a circular pattern.
points.canvas: Utilized HTML canvas for image processing.
points.deployment: Used GitHub Actions for automatic deployment.

points.overview: Implemented the rules of the Othello game in Typescript, and created a UI with React.js.
points.minimax: Used the minimax algorithm with alpha-beta pruning to create an AI that demonstrates a reasonable quality of play.
points.webworkers: Made use of web workers and asynchronous programming to avoid freezing the UI as the algorithm performs computations.
points.deployment: Used GitHub actions to automatically redeploy the app on each new commit.

points.overview: Used recursive backtracking to write algorithms to generate and solve random Sudoku puzzles.
points.ui: Created a user interface to allow the user to play through the puzzles.
points.utils: Implemented common utilities into the game such as undoing previous moves and taking notes.
points.deployment: Used GitHub actions to automatically redeploy the app on each new commit.

ta.title: Teaching Assistant - Assembly Language/COBOL
ta.title2: Teaching Assistant - Assembly Language (S/370) and Enterprise Application Environments (JCL, COBOL, S/370)

points.teach: Provided individualized instruction and support to students.

teach2.main: Provided individualized instruction to students as needed. Assisted students with issues such as:
teach2.abends: ABENDs (in both COBOL and Assembly) and JCL errors.

points.respond: Answered student inquiries and communicated via email or video/voice calls.
points.software: Installing software required for the course.

points.enterprise: Enterprise Application Environments (JCL, COBOL, High-Level Assembly).

os.java: Includes writing a mock operating system in Java with a process scheduler and access controls.
os.asm: Includes writing programs in a fictional assembly language to demonstrate the functionality of the operating system.

points.gpa: GPA: 4.0; Graduated with honors; summa cum laude.
points.courses: Relevant Coursework: Data Science (Python \& R), Probability \& Statistics, Calculus I - Calculus III.
points.lab: Worked in a university neuroscience lab (August 2019 - March 2020).
points.band: Participated in eight years of marching band (high school \& college).
